title: Wayne Rooney to be given strict 'pre-season' regime before joining Derby

Wayne Rooney will be ordered to do a pre-season by Derby before he can play for them from January.

The record scorer for England and Manchester United is on holiday in Barbados after his time in the MLS with DC United ended.

Toronto thumped DC 5-1 to quash their hopes in the end of season play-offs.

Rooney, 33, is now on a family break before finalising a date to join up with the Championship Rams.

Mirror Sport understands the forward will be asked to work on his fitness with the club before he pulls on a Derby shirt competitively.

(Image: MEGA/Queensofthenorth / MEGA)

It is likely to mean Rooney will have to follow a strict regime over Christmas.

He is due to be registered from January as a player-coach with County, who are 15th in the second tier.

Rooney has signed on an initial 18-month contract until the summer of 2021, with the option of a further year.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

He joins from America where he had 23 goals and 15 assists in 49 games for DC.

Phillip Cocu's Derby are back in action tomorrow (Wednesday) at home to Wigan after a five-game unbeaten run was ended in a 3-0 loss at Charlton.

As it stands , Rooney will not be available for the Rams' Championship clash at home to Barnsley on New Year's Day because that is the first day he can register as a player with the EFL.

That would change if the Barnsley game is moved to the following day for TV.

Derby's next fixture after Barnsley will be an FA Cup third-round tie on the weekend of January 4 and 5 before a league game at Middlesbrough on January 11.
description: The former Manchester United striker will join the Rams from January after a family break
